intro: Lastrea deflexa, commonly known as the bent-leaved lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its compact, low-growing form. Its leaves are often fleshy and may have a bluish or grayish hue, aiding in water retention. Lastrea deflexa produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, typically during the spring and summer seasons.
